result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Victor Phillip Trussell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Victor Phillip Trussell appeared by video.  Attorney Maryann Corea appeared by video for Victor Phillip Trussell.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record via Zoom. State is in compliance with victim notification. Defense seeking DPA resolution and requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 15 via Zoom.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Victor Phillip Trussell in court with attorney Maryann Corea.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
State's motion on modification of no contact order.  Statements by the parties and KLV.  Court will modify no contact order to allow no violent contact with KLV.  State will provide court with proposed order for signature.  Case adjourned, Br. 15.  Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Victor Phillip Trussell in court with Attorney Haley E Wentz on behalf of Attorney Maryann Corea.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/LIVE ON DACAST.  Case in court for pretrial conference.  Defense acknowledges receipt of discovery and an offer.  Defense requests a status and bail/bond hearing date to address the request from KLV to modify the no contact order.  Court set date as requested.  This matter will be held in person in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15 in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Hearing on no contact order scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Ann M V., Christina M V., Shantina M W., Theresa R G., Brenda L L., Kathyrn Lynn V. and IP dob 5/14/2017
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Victor Phillip Trussell in court with attorney Maryann Corea.  Defendant Victor Phillip Trussell in custody.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
  This hearing may be streamed live through DACAST at the Court's discretion: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79
Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
